[http://www.cnn.com/2005/LAW/10/21/vitale.suspect/ Vitale slaying suspect charged with murder]. Retrieved on March 13, 2007.</ref> and the [[Richardson family murders]],<ref>Reynolds, Richard, [http://www.smh.com.au/news/world/accused-killer-12-linked-to-goth-site/2006/04/27/1145861490145.html "Accused killer, 12, linked to goth site"], ''The Sydney Morning Herald'', April 28, 2006.</ref><ref>Johnsrude, Larry, [http://www.canada.com/globaltv/edmonton/news/story.html?id=b8a9c828-16ea-4f12-85b9-e0dc78feed16&k=26559 "Goths say Medicine Hat killings give them bad name"], ''Edmonton Journal'', April 26, 2006.</ref> although neither of these cases raised the same amount of media attention as the school shootings.

===Violence against goths===
â
Faces that have disappeared in time

(I ignore you)
+
In part because of public misunderstanding and ignorance surrounding gothic aesthetics, goths sometimes suffer [[prejudice]], [[discrimination]], and [[Toleration|intolerance]]. As is the case with members of various other controversial subcultures and [[alternative lifestyle]]s, outsiders sometimes marginalize goths, either by intention or by accident.<ref name="NTTimesgoldberg">Carey Goldberg [http://www.nytimes.com/1999/05/01/us/terror-littleton-shunned-for-those-who-dress-differently-increase-being-viewed.html?pagewanted=2 "Terror in Littleton: The Shunned; For Those Who Dress Differently, an Increase in Being Viewed as Abnormal"]. ''[[The New York Times]]'', May 1, 1999.</ref> Goths, like any other alternative sub-culture sometimes suffer [[intimidation]], [[humiliation]], and, in many cases, physical violence for their involvement with the subculture.<ref name = "czfeyy"/>

+
In 2006, a [[Navy]] sailor, James Eric Benham, and his brother attacked four goths in [[San Diego]] [[California]]. One goth, Jim Howard, had to be rushed to the hospital. The perpetrators of this attack were found guilty in August 2007 on four related accounts, two of which were felonies, though Benham only spent 37 days in jail. During the trial, it was made clear that the goths were assaulted due to their subculture affiliation. This can be otherwise known as a "hate crime" though the San Diego courts did not recognize this attack as such at the time.<ref>[http://angst-zine.com/archives/106 Goths and Violent Crime] Gothic Angst Webzine. 8 Sep 2007</ref><ref>[http://www.angst-zine.com/zineindex.php?id=75 Goth Help Us, San Diego] Gothic Angst Webzine. 1 May 2007</ref><ref>[http://community.livejournal.com/those_who_mourn/43011.html Vindication] Jim Howard sept 1, 2007</ref>
â

  â
i Don't even try it!You had to be a liar just to
  â
Infiltrate me-I'm still drowning!
  â
(I ignore you)
+
On 11 August 2007, a couple walking through Stubbylee Park in Bacup, Lancashire, England were attacked by a group of teenagers because they were goths. [[Murder of Sophie Lancaster|Sophie Lancaster]] subsequently died from her injuries.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/lancashire/6943848.stm Goth couple badly hurt in attack] BBC News-UK</ref><ref>Bonnie Malkin and agencies [http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml?xml=/news/2007/08/24/npark124.xml Woman 'attacked for being a Goth' dies] Telegraph.co.uk News</ref> On 29 April 2008, two teens Ryan Herbert and Brendan Harris were convicted for the murder of Lancaster and given life sentences, three others were given lesser sentences for the assault on her boyfriend Robert Maltby. In delivering the sentence Judge Anthony Russell stated "This was a hate crime against these completely harmless people targeted because their appearance was different to yours." He went on to defend the goth community, calling goths "perfectly peaceful, law-abiding people who pose no threat to anybody."<ref>[http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/2008/04/29/life-jail-trms-for-teenage-thugs-who-killed-goth-girl-86908-20398652/ Life jail trms for teenage thugs who killed goth girl]</ref><ref>[http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/two-teenagers-sentenced-to-life-over-murder-of-goth-817218.html Two teenagers sentenced to life over murder of Goth]</ref><ref>[http://newsroom.mtv.com/2008/04/30/teenage-murderers-of-peaceful-goth-sentenced-to-life/ Teenage Murderers of 'Peaceful' Goth Sentenced to Life]</ref> Judge Russell add that he "recognised it as a hate crime without Parliament having to tell him to do so, and had included that view in his sentencing."<ref>[http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/display.var.2233349.0.sophies_family_and_friends_vow_to_carry_on_campaign.php Sophie's family and friends vow to carry on campaign]</ref> Despite this ruling, a bill to add discrimination based on subculture affiliation to the definition of hate crime in British law was not presented to parliament.<ref>[http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/s/1043926_call_for_hate_crimes_law_change Call for hate crimes law change]</ref>

Take this away
+
In 2008, Paul Gibbs, a Briton from [[Leeds]], [[UK]] was attacked by three men. He and his group of about 20 young goths were on a camping trip in the vicinity of Rothwell when two 18-year-olds (Quinn Colley, Ryan Woodhead) and one 22-year-old (Andrew Hall) raided, stabbed four of the men and robbed two women. Quinn Colley had previously appeared in a homemade clip rapping on his love of violence.<ref>[http://www.rothwelltoday.co.uk/news/Video-Rothwell-thug-who-rapped.5348257.jp Rothwelltoday.co.uk]</ref> Gibbs was offered a motorbike ride by the attackers who at first insidiously befriended the group. On their way, they knocked Gibbs from the bike, rendered him unconscious with a helmet, and sliced off his ear. Afterwards, the attackers returned to the camp.
â
Take this away
  â
I can feel it on my mouth
  â
I can taste you on my fingers
  â
I can hear you like the Holy Ghost
  â
And kill you if you get too close
  â
(I ignore you)
+
Colley and Woodhead were sentenced to at least 2.5 years of prison while Hall at least 4.5 years. Gibbs' ear was found 17 hours later, thus doctors could not immediately reattach it. Instead, they stitched it inside his abdomen with the hope that some of the [[Tissue (biology)|tissue]] will re-grow. The ear could be reconstructed by using [[cartilage]] removed from Gibbs' [[ribs]].<ref>[http://alterophobia.blogspot.com/2008/09/mass-assault-on-goths-in-leeds.html Alterophobia.blogspot.com]</ref><ref>[http://www.rothwelltoday.co.uk/news/Rothwell-park-attack-Goth-victim.5348497.jp Rothwelltoday.co.uk]</ref><ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/howaboutthat/5500384/Man-who-had-ears-cut-off-had-it-stitched-to-stomach-to-save-it.html Telegraph.co.uk]</ref><ref>[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,525826,00.html Foxnews.com]</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1192285/Man-ear-hacked-stitched-inside-stomach--surgeons-work-reattach-it.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=Man whose ear was hacked off has it stitched inside his stomach... while surgeons work out how to reattach it | date=June 11, 2009}}</ref>
